definition: River on a spring night, long yuefu poem by 張若虛|张若虚[Zhang1 Ruo4 xu1]

sentences.english: I remember how one moonlit evening we went up this river in a little boat.
sentences.chinese: 我記得，在一個月夜，我們怎樣地泛舟溯河而上。

sentences.english: Gaving each other moving blessings day and night.
Wandering on a moonlit night of the killing, harvester knife pregnant think the night wind's whisper.
sentences.chinese: 徘徊在月夜的殺戮，持刀的收割者懷想着夜風的絮語。

sentences.english: Light a man sit on the swing swing, Moonlight, Star bright.
sentences.chinese: 一個人坐在鞦韆上輕蕩，月夜下，星光璀璨。

sentences.english: The moon night is my endless tears.
sentences.chinese: 月夜是我永無止境的淚水。

sentences.english: The Moon Night is kept by the Chinese Painting Academy and included into the album published by the Academy.
sentences.chinese: 《月夜》由中國畫研究院收藏，併入選該院畫集。

sentences.english: Nine years ago on a moonlit night, my grandfather and me in the garden the cool.
sentences.chinese: 九年前的一個月夜，祖父和我在園裏乘涼。

sentences.english: The sky looked serene in the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 月夜下，天空看起來一片寧靜。

sentences.english: A dry-as-dust-a matter-of-fact man who talk astronomy on a moonlit night.
sentences.chinese: 乾燥的，無味的，其實男人誰談月夜天文學。

sentences.english: The enemy was closing in and so was the night of the full moon.
sentences.chinese: 就在滿月夜那一日敵軍包圍了這裏。

sentences.english: The night, Hu Die night did not return, she crashed in the river the boat.
sentences.chinese: 月夜，胡蝶徹夜未歸，她在江裏划船失事了。

sentences.english: The stage lighting gives the effect of a moonlit scene.
sentences.chinese: 舞臺燈光產生了一副月夜景色的效果。

sentences.english: Tonight, this is how the moonlight?

definition: bright moon/refers to 夜明珠, a legendary pearl that can glow in the dark/CL:輪|轮[lun2]
Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
a branch of the Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/two-character surname Murong
spry and lively (of dancing and movements)
to regret leaving/reluctant to part/(onom.) young leaves stir gently in the wind
lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
late at night/in the dead of night
